title: Stitch Fix Isn’t a Staple for Fall
text:
Stitch Fix’s apparel service gives clients a lot for a nominal fee, but its stock may not be the bargain it seems.

The e-retailer’s quarter showed like a pair of last season’s jeans: Acceptable, but nothing to get too excited about. Revenue of $432 million was in line with guidance and consensus estimates. Importantly, active clients grew 18% from a year earlier to 3.2 million, meeting Wall Street’s expectations. The company also said it grew net revenue per active client 9% from a year earlier—the fifth consecutive quarter...
description: Stitch Fix reported decent quarterly earnings, but it is too soon to say if its growth bets will pay off.
